senses.sense_definition: Not removed from the shell, typically referring to nuts, eggs, or shellfish.

examples.text: Many people prefer snacking on <w>inshell</w> pistachios because it slows down their eating.
The recipe calls for fresh <w>inshell</w> scallops rather than the frozen meat.

senses.sense_definition: A product, such as a nut or shellfish, that has not been removed from its shell.

examples.text: The factory ships <w>inshells</w> in large sacks to processing plants.
Farmers often get a different price for <w>inshells</w> compared to shelled nuts.

senses.sense_definition: To enclose or hide something inside a shell or shell-like covering.

examples.text: The small creature <w>inshelled</w> itself to protect its soft body from the environment.
He felt <w>inshelled</w> within his own private world, safe from outside judgment.
